editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: ORIGEN, HOMILIES ON O. T. BOOKS; S. XIII in.

msItem.note: fol. ii is blank but for a list of contents, s. xviii.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Joshua 9–26
msItem.rubric: Incipit omelia nona Origenis de altari quod edificauit Iesus
msItem.incipit: Post ea quam subuertit Iesus Gai
msItem.explicit: et ubi est uerus Israel in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1420; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 30 (1921), pp. 345–463; SChr 71 (1960), pp. 242–500; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6181.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Judges
msItem.incipit: De eo quod scriptum est in libro Iudicum
Lector quidam lectionis presentis ita legebat
msItem.explicit: ut ab Ipso uictoriam consequi mereamur in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1421; ed. Baehrens, pp. 464–522; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6183.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homily on I Samuel
msItem.incipit: Non tunc tantummodo Deus plantatuit paradysum
msItem.explicit: ut in nouitate uite ambulem in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1423; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 1–25; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6185.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on the Song of Songs
msItem.incipit: Quomodo dicimus per Moysen esse quedam non solum sancta sed et sancta sanctorum
msItem.explicit: ut digni efficiamur sponsi sermone sapiencia Christi Iesu cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1432; ed. Baehrens, pp. 26–60; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6199; Lambert 206.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Isaiah
msItem.explicit: per singula opera et efficeris Filius Dei in Christo Iesu cui ...

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Jeremiah
msItem.incipit: Quo tempore Ieremias exorsus est prophetare
msItem.explicit: magnificare omnipotentem Deum cum Christo Iesu cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1438, 1; PL 25. 585–692, with a different prol.; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6205; Lambert 212.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Ezechiel
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Eusebii Ieronimi in omelias Origenis super Ezechiel numero quattuordecim
msItem.incipit: Magnum est quidem amice quod postulas
Non omnis qui captiuus est propter peccata
msItem.explicit: glorificantes Deum omnipotentem per Iesum Christum cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1440; SChr 352 (1989), pp. 30–442; Lambert 214; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6208.

supportDesc.extent:
155 leaves (ii + 153) 330 225
240 155
the edges heavily retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: a singleton, 1–188, 198(8 canc.); the quires numbered at the end, almost all cropped.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 37 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single early gothic bookhand of middling quality, probably French. Marginal annotation in several hands of s. xv-xvi in.: a neat anglicana of s. xv, the secretary hand of Fitzjames (see below), and at least one other of similar date.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 1 is a large (31-line) and handsome initial P in ‘Channel style’, pink, orange and blue with knotwork and interlace, on a gold ground, with red and blue display script. Elsewhere red or blue initials flourished in the other colour. Rubrication by the scribe of the text.

binding.p: As for MS 8, presumably replacing one of s. xvii, resewn on five bands. fols. i-ii, 152–3 are paper binding leaves.

history.provenance: On fol. iiv, presumably autograph, ‘Liber magistri Ricardi Fytz James sacre theologie professoris, quem emit 12 die Nouembris anno Christi 1482 precii x s.’; ‘Li 5us’, showing that the book was in a College electio, and a list of contents, c. 1500; in the untidy secretary hand of c. 1500, ‘Origenes super Iosue ex dono domini Ricardi Fitz James nuper Cicestrensis episcopi et custodis istius collegii, cuius anime propicietur Deus Amen’; below this is mounted the former parchment label from the back cover with Fitzjames’ armorial and ‘Origenes super Iosue ex dono domini Ricardi fitz James nuper Cicestrensis episcopi et custodis istius collegii’. Richard Fitzjames (BRUO 691–2) was fellow from c. 1468, warden 1483–1507, bishop of Chichester 1503–6, of London 1506–22. Below again is the College bookplate.

At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘253’ (recte 255), s. xvii. ‘6’ is inked on the foredge. Inside the front board is ‘N. 1. 9.’, canc and replaced by ‘A. 2. 9 (IX)’ in red on the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

listBibl.bibl: Coxe, p. 6; Powicke, no. 1183; Alexander & Temple, no. 142.
